It's tough to imagine exactly what the hell Mr. Renteal wanted out of this. If he wanted to provoke an elderly bear into running around, terrified and paranoid, there are numerous underground establishments that are able to provide this for much less work.

Also, does anyone else get the impression that the police station used to be a Denny's or something? I've seen that happen with banks, but, I mean, shit...

Yes!

Plus, the drug dealers/users looking for short-order line cook work...

name: dapooka
text:
I have a theory about Denny's.

You ever notice that when you go into a Denny's you always see the same homeless guy nursing a cup of joe at the counter? Or if it's late at night, you see the same group of drunk/high/etc. high school or college students in the 6-person corner booth just past the coffee bar, giggling quietly about some double-entendre on the menus? Or if they're not there it's because of the cruiser out front and the two cops sitting in that first booth to your left filling out their paperwork?

I can't be the only one who notices these people, since they're here each and every time I walk into ANY Denny's. And all Denny's look exactly the same on the inside - no variation. NONE.

My theory? There is only ONE Denny's . All their locations are nothing a sophisticated warp device that sends you to that one Denny's in the universe.

text: And the insidious purpose of this technology is ...?

Oh hell yes chubbied.

In high school, I conducted a sort of linguistic experiment/prank, in which I used "boff/boffing" as slang for fucking. From there, it spread; ending in the ultimate payoff when some jock-looking dude, upon overhearing my friend describe his weekend plays, gave him a random hi-five and a knowing grin.
The end.

name: nonamejoe
text:
Mr Teal refers to The Publican as Keith. Now we find out The Boffin's name is Keith "Garrey" Renteal. And isn't Mr. Teal a wren? I can't be bothered to check back two strips, but it gets curiouser and curiouser.

name: thorfinn
text: Mr. Teal is in fact a finch, but it appears that you are correct about them all being the same person.

name: nonamejoe
text:
Is "finch" an old English word for "wren"?

No.

Perhaps it is an olde English word for "the" or "mr"?

I can find no evidence of this. On the one site I looked.

However it IS an old DOS command for "rename". So... the Boffin's name could be read as

Publican's_First_Name "Boffin's_Nickname" AKA_Mr_Teal

name: nonamejoe

text: True finches belong to the family Fringillidae . The word derives from Old English finc ; related to Dutch vink and German Fink .

text:
learninating the countryside
learninating the peasants
learninating all the peoples
and their thatched roof COTTAGES!

name: tekende
text: I have no more chubbies, but I wanted to acknowledge that both of these comments are very funny.

name: gouldgonewild
text: I missed this comment when I made mine. Sorry.

name: atrusrand
text: Now I'm just completely confused. Onstad has done it again. Keeping me completely out of the blue when it comes to what's going to happen next.

name: atrusrand
text: But I just realized something. Keith's last name is RENTEAL. Figure it out.

name: rowboat
text: Congratulations on being the twentieth person on this board to figure that out.

name: mjfitzge
text:
so was it mr. teal's (aka the boffin's) plan all along to get into the remote virtual drive?

so that he could look at all the kiddie porn he wanted?

THAT FINCH MAKES ME SICK!

name: i_love_kate
text: Cornelius is about to enter a world where the only possible course of action is chugging convicts' hogs.

name: i_love_kate

name: mjfitzge
text:
there was only one personality all along!

damn that shrovis-bishopthorpe!

text: OMG HAX

name: ricnine
text: Good lord, I think we've all been Boffined today!

name: stevepants
text: Just the way the "HA" ":)"  "HA" is made me burst out laughing at work. Friggin classic. Also Ray's dialogue.

name: maximus
text:
[IMGS OFF]
Mr Boffin laughs last

name: invidious
text: A comment left by invidious was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, blastradius, GregChant, cyberia)

name: dans
text: I think we need to start reading each other's comments, guys.

name: invidious
text:
Yeah, go ahead and lame away.

However, when I opened this comic for the first time there were only like ten comments on the page. By the time I posted my comment, 28 other people had said the exact same thing.

Trying to post an original thought on this site can sometimes be like challenging The Flash to a hundred-yard dash. Dammit.

name: achilleselbow
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: iseedeadpixels
text: I chubbied so hard I gave it two.

name: pogo
text: Can't see the picture, elbow.  Using Explorer.  What's up, techies?

name: avery86
text: You're using Explorer.

name: numberkillinger
text:
1. Use Firefox
2. The problem is unrelated, at least you are using Firefox now.

name: cbtbone
text:
MUST...GO...DOWNLOAD...FIREFOX...

HYPNOTOAD...COMMANDS...IT...

name: mikeronomicon
text: Lick the toad! Lick the toad! Lick the toad!

name: dans
text: Sorry! I didn't mean to get all internet-asshole on you.

name: pogo
text: Now wait, if you truly had an original thought, there would be no one else with that thought.  They very fact that you find your thought repeated several times should tell you that you are among a group of like-minded sheep who bleet the same shit predictably.  Hardly original.  Mid-bell-curve ordinary.

name: invidious
text: Amended reply: Damn it's hard being the first sheep to bleat on this site.

name: pogo
text: Why read when you can spew?

name: glyphtheory
text: I hope this time of incarceration has allowed Cornelius to mentally compose a scathingly eloquent letter to Shrovis-Bishopthorpe regarding the nature of their operating system and it's so-called assistants.

text: oh man, remember when all computer viruses did was laugh at you?  before they figured out how to steal your wallet?  you were all "damn, optimus prime, I just wanted to play some fucking arkanoid."

name: gouldgonewild
text: keith

name: mjfitzge
text:
anyone else notice that a disproportionately large number of the really awesome achewood's happen when it's nighttime?

even though the strips are completely unrelated, it reminds me beef jumping off the bridge and floating down the river.

sigh.

name: synapse
text: "Finger trace". This is what Ray does when he's drunk.

name: hamscout
text: Fourty-five degrees

name: ih8jonmayr
text: chubby for the Muse avatar.

name: tekende
text: But ih8jonmayr, they're silly! It is silly to like Muse!

name: ford
text: Goddammit i kept my mouth shut when you fuckers messed with the cure (because i hate them), but Muse is a solid band with a good, fairly intricate sound, and having had a couple of their more poppy, inane ditties on mtv a few times is no reason to be a dick.

name: ford
text: (No real anger intended, i just get pissed off when anything any group of people likes is deemed idiotic by otherwise-smart, non-douchetastic people here)

name: stop
text: You, too, can get trashed at Sergeant Bill's. Just call (900)523-2923 next Friday night.

name: speccer
text: It'll be a night you won't forget! Unless you do.

name: baryonyx
text: I have to say, this is the first arc in a long time to end up somewhere much different from where it began. I think that's what separates the real arcs in the archive from the little bursts of half-formed storylines Onstad has been putting out in the more recent past.

name: loneal
text: I hope this experience does not come between Cornelius and Beef.

name: tekende
text: Whoa, what if...what if Beef is the Boffin?

name: mjfitzge
text:
interesting.

first, i wonder if anyone is the boffin/publican/finch. it could just be a schizophrenic computer, and that's that.

if there is charactorial personification of the shrovis-bishopthorpe, i think that nolan and beef are likely suspects.

nolan, because he was after the porn. (and also because him giving the police a tip on his whereabouts as a piece of his plan would be fucking awesome.) also, he most likely has the computer know-how to pull this off from being on the computer all day reading his fetish newsgroups.

beef, because he seems like he probably likes to hack stuff. and also because none of us have any clue what he's been up to through all of this. although i have no idea what his motive might be.

i suppose nice pete and lie bot could also be suspects, due to their proclivity for nefarious deeds.

needless to say, i am excited for tomorrow. and i think this is the best arc in a long time.

name: tekende
text:
Quote:
nolan, because he was after the porn.


What porn? The FBI only thought there was porn on the disk; there wasn't. There is no porn in this scenario.

name: mjfitzge
text:
let me preface what i am about to say with this - i know nothing about hacking.

what i meant (and did not say very clearly) was that perhaps the result of this hack is that by inserting the disk into the FBIs remote virtual drive, the hacker could have access to all of the secretly stored away kiddie porn. that is where they keep the evidence of past kiddie porn peddlers, right?

even if this is not possible, i think we should all be able to suspend our disbelief and say it is.

name: blastradius
text: A comment left by blastradius was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, tekende, rowboat, HSE, loneal, stop, AlbinoSquid, achilleselbow, iidebaser, Doc_Rostov, lastlarf, botch)

name: flazisismuss
text: Except they seem to be putting the software on the FBI's secret virtual porn computer.  Maybe that's where they keep all the porn?  That would be why it's so hard to find porno these days.

name: tekende
text: Okay yes you're right I understand now sheesh.

name: tekende
text: Er, that reply was for all three of you, not just flazisismuss. But I have a special raised middle finger for blastradius.

name: mjfitzge
text:
let it be noted i was just replying in a conversational manner to a question raised about my own post.

therefore i demand the sheesh be retracted, or at least pointed in the proper direction (away from me).

name: achilleselbow
text: Don't worry about him, he's just lashing out because he's still mad about his kiddie porn being confiscated.

name: flazisismuss
text: I assumed tekende was saying that the porn was a red herring for something more interesting, or less icky at any rate.  In other words, he assumed that the assertion that Nolan was involved must have been untrue, since Ray took care of that loathsome person.    So chubbied for the faith in Ray you have displayed.

name: ih8jonmayr
text: Not really a reply, but I have a question. Was Nolan the child molester who talked with Philippe when he ran the Potty Pals service? Or am I just smashed from Sgt. Bill's.

name: tekende
text: Yes, he was, and yes, you are.

name: odei
text:
Quote:
he most likely has the computer know-how to pull this off from being on the computer all day reading his fetish newsgroups.


I have to say, looking at porn and talking about sex does not, unfortunately, teach you anything about computers or coding. It does reveal a lot of horrible things about humanity though.

name: mjfitzge
text: true.  in fact internet porn addicts may have even more trouble being computer savvy.  every time you get on the computer to learn some thing you're all "oh, i'll just look at a little porn first."

name: cleave
text:
Actually because of my crippling internet pornography addiction I have developed preternatural skill in avoiding any virus or pop-up that these sites shoot at me.

Also I have mastered reformatting my hard drive.

Thanks porn!

name: anabanananana
text: Perhaps the ultimate goal of Nolan, if he is indeed the culprit, is not to steal all of the kiddie porn but to get as many people as possible out of the house, leaving Philippe unattended.

for uninhibited buggering..!


daaaaaaaaaaaaaamn

name: thegoodwillgirl
text:
I find that "I don't mean that in a snide, bitchy way" usually means "I know that sounded snide and bitchy, but I'm sticking with it anyhow."

Or at least that's what it means when I say it.

name: norrin
text:
My favorite "I don't mean to be/sound X" is "racist."

I don't mean to be racist but I hate you for your skin color and nothing else.

name: theirateturk
text: IM TAKING OFF YOUR PANTIS (  )(  )ZZZZZZZZZZZZD~~

name: theirateturk
text: lmao now i understand what jay-z meant by the gift and the curse

name: theirateturk
text:
WAIT: this (joke?) only works if your browser resolution settings are very messed up.

Hmm I deliberated whether to add a third post to an unready unnecessary second post but looks like I've reached that decision

name: rowboat
text: Less than a year after all this, theguitarhero would turn the "goodbye forever" post into an art form. I mean, a terrible art form, but an art form nonetheless.

name: numberkillinger
text: It has been a rollercoaster of emotions theirateturk, the highs, the lows, the intermediates. Truly your 19 posts have integrated you into the community more than I thought possible, you will be sorely missed. Every time I achieve minor celebrity, I will think of you.

name: doc_rostov
text:
Jesus Christ, people. If you can't get the sarcasm in that post, you shouldn't be reading Achewood in the first place. That post was as amusing as the usual Manflesh. That is, absurdist self-referential tripe. But it's amusing tripe. It'd be nice if we all could stop taking this whole place so seriously every once in a while. If we continue on our PATH TO DESTRUCTION, I fear I will soon be forced to inquire of you a serious, sober question.

WHAT HAVE WE HAVE BECOME?

name: numberkillinger
text:
Notice:
a) The chubby/lame ratio for his post.
b) The series of sarcastic responses.
I'm pretty sure everyone is just having a fine old time with amusing tripe. Stop taking this place so seriously.

name: achilleselbow
text:
It's funny how there's no way to point out that people are taking things too seriously without being guilty of the same thing.

Actually, it's not funny at all.

name: lawbot
text: NO

name: doc_rostov
text:
Don't know, man. You obviously were being sarcastic, but I gotta say. Some of those comments seemed absolutely serious. Some of them. And goodness knows that it's quite serious a business to criticize other people for being overly serious. In fact, it invokes a certain 'serious' manner best suited for response to those who take things so seriously as to appear to be a prick. It is obvious, though, that the serious demeanor utilized by the person is unwarranted in and of itself and is criticized in the post in a self-referential cycle of blithely obvious inanity, leading to a veritable Möbius strip of humor.

Or did I just BLOW YOUR MIND ?

Oh, I didn't?

Okay, well. That's awkward. Nice avatar anyway!

name: diggidy
text:
You'll be back.
You'll ALL be back.
You can't live without the sweet, sweet chubbies. You're like animals, constantly chasing the high, never getting enough.
Oh, sure, you'll try to stop. You might last a few hours, a day, a week, a month. Maybe it'll be years from now. You'll have a wife and kids. Perhaps an old girlfriend, who came back to you once she realized you'd truly broken the addiction.
But it never really ends. You'll find yourself thinking wistfully about "The good old days", when your verbal antics were the delight of the acheworld.
You'll think longingly of the nights you used to spend lovingly composing every paragraph, every sentence. You'll scroll through the archives, reliving the carefree devil-may-cry days of your youth.

And you'll post. Oh God, how you'll post.

I'll be there to see it too, as your new life falls to shambles. I'll be there, watching. I'll be there.

Because I have nothing better to do.

name: pogo
text:
Well hot-diggidy, you've got the BB addiction down, boy. Too bad I'm out of chubs. Maybe some passer-by will drop on on ya.

And it's not that we have nothing better to do, this is actual commuinication going on here, not pornification. We are exercising our minds, our wits, and our writing skills. That can't be bad, even if the level of discourse dips into the shitter once in a while.

name: theirateturk
text: IT'S LIKE THERE'S A PARTY IN MY MOUTH, AND CHUBBIES ARE THE CURRENCY

name: drskradley
text:
But trying to be witty and achieving minor celebrity is entertaining. It's like playing a video game. Some peeps got Xboxes, some peeps got this. It's fun time-wasting, inanycase.

If you are being serious with your criticising of what we do here, you must criticise not just the entirety of the Internet (which ain't freaking difficult), but also the entire entertainment industry.

And by so doing, and to avoid utter asscock hypocrisy, you must separate yourself from it completely. Either be completely efficient and useful in all you do (which would be awesome! ), or just enjoy it and stop yer bitchin'.

That's if you're being serious. If not....eeeeeeehhhhhh I dunno. I get it, but kinda criticise the workmanship.

name: drskradley
text: Wait, I'm an asshole.  I just read that post of yours all the way from top to bottom now.  Hilarious!  We cool, man, we cool.

text: The real mystery in the hacker's name is the "Garrey" bit. Does he have any relation to this Gary?

name: atrusrand
text: Highly doubtful.

text: Somewhere, Nicholas Cage is singing "So Happy Together" to himself while Charlie Kaufman cackles.

text: Connie needs just two minutes back at hi scar, working the tequila optic, then that pig-cat has a whole new problem on his hands

why is it that people always assume hackers will leave a grinning, baneful skull on their desktop after the deed is done?

this rather confuses me

name: lonis
text: No, they would be terrible. Would you want to see everyone wearing the internet? Everyone would be walking around with flashing Sean John ads and retarded sparkly myspace images. That shit belongs trapped in computers, tucked away from the real world.

name: boredom_man
text: It would only be terrible if you consider Western Civilization worth saving. Personally, I want to manufacture t-shirts that play a selected (yet overpopular) theme song every time the wearer enters a room. Nukes are for pussies.

text:
And for you I provide:
http://www.thinkgeek.com/tshirts/illuminated/a5bf/

name: boredom_man
text: Thank you. Relief floods every bitter fiber of my being. And for you, a stock tip: there will be no more stocks.

name: dumase
text: You are wrong.

text: Imagine the famous dancing baby animation.  Recall how ubiquitous that was during the first 2 or 3 years of the mainstreaming of the internet.  I can see something that hideous being plastered on every idiot's chest in America.  I do not want to see such a day.

'Garrey' must have really done his research into the classics in order to fool Cornelius.
Also: Teodor's first panel of dialogue essentially describes what I have thinking all day. (minus spreading)

text: It sounds like you have had a weird day. I have had those kind of days. Deeply unsettling.

name: mrclarinet
text: I knew that The Boffin was going to end up playing a crucial role in this little theatre of the unnatural.

text: I KNEW that fucking boffin was up to something. Sleeping indeed.

name: nice-on-water
text:
Meanwhile, in Australia, Nolan strikes again!

http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/7348339.stm

name: iseedeadpixels
text: I would click on that but I really dont want to.

name: earendil
text: do, do click on it.  It's both relevant and hilarious.

name: iseedeadpixels
text: Oh yes, thank you Mike Gravel. I was just a bit worried that i would be clicking on a story about a pedarist.

name: farqussus
text: Mike Gravel? Who is that dude? He looks like Gary Busey's dad.

name: scraggg
text: A candidate for President of the United States and a possible fan of Andy Warhol's films.

name: farqussus
text:
While I don't know exactly why that might be true, I can imagine.

So this is a guy people could vote for in good conscience?

name: dapooka
text:
I'm reasonably sure he's dropped out by now, as you never hear anything about him.

Of course about all you heard about him before always directed you to the video above.

name: earendil
text: Actually, he joined the Libertarian Party so that he could stay in the race right up to the election, instead of having to withdraw after the democratic convention.

name: tekende
text: What, is he just staying in the race for fun then?

name: flazisismuss
text: Once upon a time he was a serious statesman of some repute.  His quest for the democratic nomination, though quixotic, was amusing, and it did serve to illustrate certain uncomftorable truths about our political system, which puts him one up on McCain, at least.

name: farqussus
text: Having McCain as the Republican nomination illustrates many uncomfortable truths about your political system.

name: maximus
text: Oh no you don't - there's too much of that crap on the intarwebs already

name: cromar
text: Your face illustrates may uncomfortable truths about your mother's use of crack and pcp while you were in womb XD

name: farqussus
text: that's pretty funny actually.

name: invidious
text:
The greatest, most relevant politcal discussion ever:
Ted and Dan talk politics

name: alreadyinuse
text: "system?"  that's stretching it.  American Idol is more of a system than this mess.

name: tekende
text: Ha, awesome.

name: boscostacy
text: That would be South Side Nolan.

name: tommythebrat
text: This comic much like when I saw the Vagina Monologues, I went in expecting answers but all it did was raise further questions.

name: achilleselbow
text: I went in expecting girls to draw little faces on their vaginas and make them talk like a sideways mouth. I was disappointed.

name: numberkillinger
text: man, I read that as "I went in expecting little girls to draw faces on their vaginas and make them talk like a sideways mouth." It freaked me out. Is this a problem with my eyes or my brain?

name: alreadyinuse
text: ditto. i had to do a double take.  it is a brain problem but maybe just a problem in low-level neural-visual-linguistic pattern recognition processing, instead of being a high-level-pedophile-pervert-cognitive dysfunction.  maybe.

text: i read it the way it was written and am now thinking you're all a little bit nolan.

name: dusty
text: For the grand finale 7 of them would reenact the episode of M.A.S.H. where Colonel Henry Blake is sent home and subsequently shot down over the Sea of Japan. White thongs are used for surgical masks, I don't think I have to tell you how the tears are accomplished.

name: zeltaen
text: REEENNNNTEEEEEAAAAAALLLLLL!

text: I cannot describe the level of joy I experienced upon reading "Oh, terrible! "

name: achilleselbow

text: It's too late right now and I'm very tired, but I'll get back to you on this.

text: [IMGS OFF]

text: [IMGS OFF]

text: I'll leave her dancing for a while, so she earns it.

name: heccibiggs
text: That's it! Thank you! Chubchubchub.

name: tetsujin
text: How did Teodor get in to Cornelius's laptop?  He doesn't know the password!

name: nicolae
text: Clickin' a titmouse isn't exactly hacking into the Pentagon...so I've heard.

name: ihmgard
text: *Gasp*!

name: kelissamunz
text: Probably off eating the Tesco pizza. It's not as good as Sainsbury's, but honestly--who would waste it when the Publican is clearly distracted.

name: loneal
text:
I am studying in England and have just learned the difference between Sainsbury's and Tesco, and your post is extremely exciting to me. The Sainsbury's and Tesco are almost exactly equidistant from where I'm staying, and I have to make a difficult decision every time I go shopping. Now I know what to do about pizza.

Pizza tangent: Pizza Hut is a middle-of-the-road sit-down restaurant here! What the fuck!

name: kelissamunz
text:
True story: eat the damn Sainsbury's steamable dinners. Best idea ever. You get an entire dinner with absolutely no effort, and it doesn't suck like regular TV dinners. I'm partial to the chicken alfredo with broccoli myself.

Don't waste your time in M&S groceries, either. Do, however, go clothes shopping in the big store on Oxford Street. For some reason they charge ridiculous prices on food, but their clothing is reasonable.

Oh, and as for American restaurants: Burger King and McDonald's are unremarkable except for the bizarre "American" decor. Apparently they think we're all about ZZ Top and old pickup trucks. Avoid American Fried Chicken like the sketchy place it is.

Learn much from your time abroad. I know I did.

name: tekende
text: There's a store that sells both clothing and food??

name: fineoakstructure
text: Wal Mart.

name: tekende
text:
...Oh.

Yeah.

I...I feel kinda stupid now.

name: irondave
text: and Target and Meijer's.  Harrod's, of course.  It's a big world out there.  I don't know if any of them are in Oxford, UK, but there must be some equivalent.

name: tekende
text: I guess I was picturing, like, a regular grocery store, and then in the aisle behind the box dinners and canned goods, hey, there's a sale on jeans.

name: lastlarf
text: Actually that describes a basic trip to Tesco.

name: farqussus
text: basically every grocery store in England. Except Iceland?

name: kelissamunz
text: It's okay; the concept blows my mind too. Only it would be like if Wal-Mart had CLOTHING ONLY stores and then grocery stores, and they were about as numerous as Starbucks locations. Which is another problem in London.

name: bixschmix
text: There's a store in Pittsburgh that sells candy and knives. Bulk candy in the front, knives, swords and chinese throwing stars in the back. (It's called "Candy and Knives." Not the most creative name, but it is descriptive.)

name: comrade_tom
text:
"No one goes to M&S for their big shop, you just go to get a few bits!"

The mighty Boosh once again proves it has its finger to the nations pulse.

name: hellofditties
text: That it does, comrade.

name: rowboat
text: You're not into ZZ Top and old pickup trucks? Love it or leave it, babe.

name: lawbot
text: A schizophrenic "helper?" A criminally minded "helper" with many aliases?

name: fidelio-roo
text:
That's... So awesome...
But what is more odd than awesome is when I rated this comic a 5, its overall rating went from 4.2 to 4.1 for some reason...

name: thorfinn
text: You did not refresh before rating, and several others rated it 4 or lower during the time between your most recent refresh and when you rated it.  When you rated the comic, it updated to include all of the lower ratings that had been made since you came to the page.

name: dextrose
text: I don't recall ever seeing a tail on Ray before.....

name: numberkillinger
text: recall harder.

name: tekende
text: The pitched but never-produced sequel to the famous Schwarzenneger (sp?) film: Total Recall 2: Recall Harder.

name: scraggg
text: Featuring a woman with four tits .

name: odei
text:
I was gonna say 'and two Schwarzeneggers!' but then I remembered that awful* film where that actually happened.


*Okay, it was probably on par with most Schwarzenegger films but whatever.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i Total-ly Recall that movie.

name: thorfinn
text: Don't be hatin' on the Schwarzenegger films.  The Running Man, Total Recall, Terminator, Conan the Barbarian, all classics, classics I tell you.

name: avery86
text: Really?

name: avery86
text: Crap. Awesome BBcode.

name: jollysaintpete
text: i challenge your avatar, son

name: baryonyx
text: Okay guys this is starting to look like my recurring nightmare in which I log in to Assetbar and everyone's icon is just a big terrified eye staring at me.

name: tekende
text: I have that same one except I vomit too. "Fuck, man! I barfed! I barfed because you looked into my eyes!"

name: nutmeg
text: VHUBBS that is my favorite strip

name: bixschmix
text:
Yeah that's why I decided to change from my default avatar (identical to avery) to someone that would save children.

Well, not british children.

name: starforth
text: I feel like I am watching the beginning of an episode of 'Lost.'

name: charlottien
text: Gosh. What a twist!

name: comrade_tom
text:
Other than Rays reminiscence (which was both amusing and horrendously insightful) i didn't dig this strip.
Shame, i've been enjoying this arc so far.

name: epicurus
text: While the implications in this one are shocking, the highlight for me was how perfect the cop in the bottom left panel looks. Every law enforcement agency will have MINIMUM one guy with that face and mustache.

name: tekende
text: It's required by law.

name: juan_danger
text: Mr. Teal and The Publican are the same entity! Schizo!

name: featurelessvoid
text:
"Garrey" Renteal is an anagram of "Grayer" Eternal. Who is the the grayest and most indubitably eternal citizen of Achewood? Why, no other than the community's elder statesman, Cornelius Bear.

I thus submit that Cornelius himself planted the ad for the Shrovis as a practical joke on Roast Beef, left the evidence trail as a practical joke on Ray, and crafted the "you have been hacked" diskette as a practical joke on the police.

Note further the date on which Cornelius first asked Beef to find him a suitable computer: April 1st .

Mr. Bear has once again proved himself to be the baddest of badasses, this time by orchestrating an April Fools prank that kept growing for two weeks straight.

name: lawbot
text: NO

name: fattybeaver
text: Fuck he writes a strip like this when I have a test tomorrow. Now I'm gunna spend the rest of the night coming back here every 10 minutes reading anything green. If this arc doesnt end before finals I might as well turn in an application at Denny's.

name: thorfinn
text: You mean yellow, right, because you could read most of the green posts the first time through, but new posts are highlighted yellow.

name: tekende
text: I suppose that, depending on your monitor settings, they could show up as green. Maybe.

name: fattybeaver
text: I skim everything but I only really READ the green. That way I know what I am supposed to like and can live my life accordingly.

name: talgkjertel
text: whats the rush

name: dougthehead
text:
Holy crap, featurelessvoid. I have no idea if that's true, but a chubby for effort and style, man.

Best line of the story in this strip, too: "You don't forget a night like that. I mean, unless you do."

name: ford
text: I knew the boffin was neuromancer

name: sharpdresseddan
text: I knew it!!! Damn you Boffin! DAMN YOU TO HELL!!! Roast Beef will repay your transgressions ten-fold!

name: gladi8orrex
text: so like it was all a trick or somethin' after all lol

name: jollysaintpete
text: just like when your mom said you could be anything you wanted and that she wasn't fucking the milkman

name: achilleselbow
text: gladi8orrex buys magazines about car stereos.

name: cromar
text: A comment left by cromar was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by invidious, bixschmix, usversusthem, NumberKillinger)

name: tekende
text: cromar is a real super-size homo jackass.

name: cromar
text: Yes, thank you.  People rarely notice.  I have a special love in my heart/ass for you.

name: thorfinn
text: You are now ignored.  You join the ranks of such notable assholes as retardo, asherdan, socks, snick, and poing.

name: cromar
text: You really have a thin skin.  Some playful joshing is all it takes :(

name: bixschmix
text: cromar needs to learn the difference between playful joshing and annoying antagonism.

name: ashemon
text: So who else Googled the name to see if it was real?

name: falseprophet
text:
Truer words of wisdom have not been said except for in panel four when Ray totally says them.

[IMGS OFF]

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ..and they give you cash, which is just as good as money.

name: cbtbone
text: it is a sad day when the first Yogi Berra quote people can think of is from the Aflac commercial.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
there were more from that commercial!! oh, wait. you mean...ohhhhh.

how's this--'if the world was perfect, it wouldn't be'

name: invidious
text: Ninety percent of downloading kiddie porn on the internet is half mental.

name: ctrl_z
text: That statement ray makes in panel 4? That is a true statement

name: sleshy
text: To Ray you never forget a night involving tracing tyres until you can stand again, but if you do forget, thats cool.

name: noah_j
text: the_bandit and the_boffin... hmmmppph.

name: dasilodavi
text:
So, The publican is named Keith. Is he ALSO the Boffin? And for that matter, why is Keith the one doing the hacking? Seriously, where IS Mr. Teal in all of this?
If I recall, later strips provide some clarity, but I don't remember if they answer this one.

name: dasilodavi
text: Yeah, OK, just checked.  The very next strip answers it.  Feel free to lame these off the board if you are so inclined.

name: lolsworth
text: HA HA

name: greenkoolayd
text: "cell-chugging hogs" is quite the delightful turn of phrase.
